page.title: 08St.Michael's Church Bodenham
page.content: The 13th century Parish Church of St. Michael's and All Angels, Bodenham is an attractive and well maintained church. The Vicar Rev. D C Miller has about 40 voluntary workers who provide flowers, sew hassocks, clean and polish. The congregation numbers are between 50 and 200.The services are usually well attended. A recent internal and welcome addition to the church is the kitchen and toilet. Refreshment is oftan served after the service and the church is also used for social functions. St. Michael's C.E. Primary School use the church twice a term for Family Services when the parents are invited to join their children for lively and joyful worship. The church yard is well mown and maintained by Mr Griffiths.
